title: Husband seeks divorce because wife makes him give oral sex during her period | Metro News
text:
Jen Mills for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 3:02 pm They are from Agege in Nigeria (Picture: Google Maps) 
A man has asked for a divorce on the basis that his wife makes him give her oral sex while she is on her period. 
Idongesit Etuk, 38, accused his wife Blessing, 40, of wanting him to ‘suck her blood’ and said that she must be in a secret cult due to her sexual preference. Donald Trump attacks 'mess at home and abroad' during rare press conference 
He told a court: ‘My wife is demonic. For several years, she will insist that we have sex when she is having her monthly flow. 
‘I didn’t have issues with that at first because she is my wife and I vowed to love her. 
‘But things got out of hand when she will always insist that I give her a blow job. 
‘Initially, I did not take her serious but she threatened to divorce me and take our two children along with her, if I don’t give her what she asks for.’ 
His wife denies trying to force him and said she only asked him to do it once. He accused his wife of being ‘demonic’ (Picture for illustration: Getty) 
The couple, from Agege, Nigeria, have been married for twelve years but the husband now says he cannot take the relationship any longer. 
‘Please, I am tired of the union,’ he told a judge. ‘If she is not in a secret cult, how can I suck her blood when I did not have any spiritual covenant with her?’ Inside the 'Satanic' home where police freed five children from their parents 
‘My wife is also abusive and arrogant. She lacks respect for my family.’ 
However, Blessing told the the court that she didn’t want a divorce, and urged the judge not to grant one. 
‘I still love my husband and I cannot bear to leave without him,’ she said. ‘My children cannot leave without a father at such tender age.’ 
She denied forcing Idongesit to suck her menstrual blood. 
‘I do not force him,’ she told court president Phillip Williams. ‘I asked him only once and when he disagreed, I did not bother him again.’ 
Mr Williams said the marriage could no longer stand as Idongesit’s life was threatened. 
He granted the divorce, saying: ‘The respondent will have custody of the children and all expenses will be paid by the complainant who will have free access to the children.’ More
